item.title: 中美紧张局势升级，中国掀起黄金交易狂潮
item.description: 上周，随着黄金交易量连续创下历史新高，以及中美贸易紧张局势加剧，中国的黄金交易出现了爆炸性的增长。【原文：China saw an explosive surge in gold trading last week as the metal hit successive records and Sino-US trade tensions rose.】

item.title: 印尼将通过金融和投资交易寻求美国的贸易青睐
item.description: 印尼将在华盛顿举行的为期一周的会谈中寻求达成贸易、投资和金融部门协议，以防止或减轻其最大贸易伙伴之一计划征收的关税。【原文：Indonesia will seek to strike trade, investment and financial-sector deals in week-long talks in Washington aimed at forestalling or mitigating planned tariffs from one of its biggest trading partners.】

item.title: 诺林丘金抛售国债，躲过特朗普引发的市场混乱
item.description: Norinchukin 银行上一财年的灾难性业绩给日本 3,000 亿美元的投资巨头带来了一线希望：它帮助日本避免了本月唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关税引发的动荡。【原文：Norinchukin Bank’s disastrous last fiscal year has had one silver lining for Japan’s $300 billion investing giant — it helped shield it from the turmoil unleashed by Donald Trump’s tariffs this month.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利、花旗下调美国财报预期，财报季拉开帷幕
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）和花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Morgan Stanley and Citigroup Inc. slashed their estimates for 2025 earnings as companies kick off their first-quarter reports, joining a wave of Wall Street banks warning that tariffs will curb profit growth.】

item.title: 投资者蜂拥而至，中国向银行提供额外黄金进口配额
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，中国人民银行已为一些商业银行分配了新的黄金进口配额，以应对贸易战升级背景下机构和散户投资者的强劲避险需求。【原文：The People’s Bank of China has allocated fresh gold import quotas for some commercial banks, people familiar with the matter said, as Beijing responds to strong haven demand from institutional and retail investors in the face of an escalating trade war.】

item.title: 亚洲美元信贷因关税遭遇五年来最严重损失
item.description: 在贸易战不断升级的背景下，亚洲美元债券遭遇了自大流行病以来的最大跌幅，这凸显了人们对该地区借款人信贷风险的担忧。【原文：Asian dollar bonds are suffering the biggest losses since the pandemic, following a selloff that underscores concerns about regional borrowers’ credit risks amid an escalating trade war.】

item.title: 高盛的科斯汀称流动性萎缩引发股票波动
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The equity market’s liquidity has deteriorated sharply in the last few weeks, contributing to a spike in volatility as tariff worries rocked markets, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.】

item.title: 毛里求斯前财政部长在欺诈案调查中获准保释
item.description: 毛里求斯警方在前财政部长 Renganaden Padayachy 因金融犯罪委员会调查欺诈案而被拘留五天后，将其保释。【原文：Mauritian police released former Finance Minister Renganaden Padayachy on bail after he spent five days in custody as part of a fraud probe by the Financial Crimes Commission.】

item.title: 美国炉灶制造商希望您了解美国制造业的哪些情况
item.description:
与中国竞争的真正障碍是什么？【原文：

What's the real impediment to competing with China?

】

item.title: 奇货可居：美国炉灶制造商对关税的看法（播客）
item.description: 奇货可居：美国炉灶制造商对关税的看法（播客）【原文：Odd Lots: What a US Stove Maker Thinks About Tariffs (Podcast)】

item.title: Gaw Capital 香港塔楼贷款延期一个月
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，总部位于香港的投资公司 Gaw Capital Partners 为两座办公楼提供的银团贷款已延期一个月，该公司与银行就再融资方案的谈判仍在继续。【原文：Hong Kong-based investment firm Gaw Capital Partners’ syndicated loan backing two office towers has been extended by a month, according to people familiar with the matter, as talks with banks on a refinancing proposal continue.】

item.title: 欧元和债券正成为另类避风港
item.description: 欧元以十五年来最快的速度反弹，交易员们押注欧元将升至 1.20 美元，策略师们则争相更新他们的预测。【原文：The euro’s fastest rally in a decade and a half is gaining traction, with traders betting on a move to $1.20 and strategists scrambling to update their forecasts.】

item.title: 人工智能股票分析聊天机器人 BridgeWise 进军迪拜
item.description: BridgeWise是一家人工智能聊天机器人提供股票投资建议的初创公司，该公司正在向海湾地区扩张，将在迪拜设立办事处作为地区总部。【原文：BridgeWise, a startup whose AI chatbot provides stock investment advice, is expanding into the Gulf region with an office in Dubai that will serve as its regional headquarters.】

item.title: 欧洲股市上涨，投资者期待关税带来一些喘息机会
item.description: 欧洲股市周一上涨，原因是投资者在关注第一季度盈利的同时，看到了新关税带来的一些喘息机会。【原文：European equities advanced on Monday as investors saw some respite from any fresh tariffs as attention turns to first-quarter earnings.】

item.title: 经济复苏后巴基斯坦的汇款额创下新高
item.description: 巴基斯坦的汇款额在 3 月份创下历史新高，这表明在国际货币基金组织贷款计划的支持下，巴基斯坦的经济正在复苏。【原文：Pakistan’s remittances rose to a record in March, signaling an economic recovery on the back of a loan program with the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 消息人士称，科莱恩正在探索低迷后提升估值的方法
item.description: 据知情人士透露，科莱恩公司（Clariant AG）正在探索提高股价的方法，因为这家化学品生产商在过去三年中损失了大约一半的价值。【原文：Clariant AG is exploring ways to boost its share price after the chemical producer lost roughly half its value over the past three years, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: ETF 流入创纪录，中国股市救市全面展开
item.description: 中国交易所交易基金获得了创纪录的资金流入，因为国家支持的买家使出浑身解数来保护市场免受唐纳德-特朗普的关税冲击。【原文：Chinese exchange-traded funds received record inflows as state-backed buyers pulled out all the stops to shield the market against Donald Trump’s tariff onslaught.】

item.title: 伍德集团报告 Sidara 可能提出每股 35 便士的收购要约
item.description: 约翰伍德集团（John Wood Group Plc）表示，它收到了工程竞争对手 Sidara 的非约束性收购建议。【原文：John Wood Group Plc said it received a non-binding takeover proposal from engineering rival Sidara.】

item.title: 日本超长期收益率因拍卖和额外预算担忧而上升
item.description: 由于对 20 年期国债拍卖和补充预算的担忧，日本超长期国债收益率飙升。【原文：Japan’s super long-term government bond yields surge amid concerns about a 20-year auction and a supplementary budget.】

item.title: 印度希望在六周内完成美国贸易谈判的关键环节
item.description: 据一位新德里官员透露，印度将于周一开始与美国进行具体部门的贸易讨论，因为这个南亚国家正急于利用唐纳德-特朗普暂停额外征税三个月的政策。【原文：India will start sector-specific trade discussions with the US on Monday, according to a New Delhi official, as the South Asian nation rushes to take advantage of Donald Trump’s three-month pause on additional levies.】

item.title: 高盛将 4,000 美元黄金提上日程，避风港之争愈演愈烈
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）和瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）发出了新一轮看涨黄金的呼声，央行需求强于预期以及黄金作为经济衰退和地缘政治风险对冲工具的作用支撑了人们对 2025 年黄金价格甚至更高的预期。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and UBS Group AG issued another round of bullish calls for gold, with stronger-than-expected central bank demand and the metal’s role as a hedge against recession and geopolitical risks underpinning expectations for even higher prices in 2025.】

item.title: 关税之痛后，LVMH 财报将考验奢侈品行业的神经
item.description: 欧洲奢侈品股今年开局动荡不安，这让投资者对该行业领头羊路威酩轩集团（LVMH）的第一季度业绩有了更多的考虑。【原文：Europe’s luxury-goods stocks have had a turbulent start to the year, giving investors plenty to consider heading into first-quarter results from sector bellwether LVMH.】

item.title: 关税将影响数百万中国工人，对经济造成打击
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战导致中国经济放缓，就业市场的蹒跚起步正在削弱中国政府与美国抗衡所需的韧性。【原文：As China staggers into a slowdown caused by Donald Trump’s trade war, a hobbled jobs market is impairing the resilience Beijing needs to battle it out against the US.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市第二周下跌后有望上涨
高盛称，如果日元逼近 130，日本央行可能考虑停止加息
item.description: 据高盛公司（Goldman Sachs Inc.【原文：The Bank of Japan may consider pausing its interest-rate hikes if the yen strengthens toward 130 per US dollar and its outlook for sustained inflation dims, according to analysts at Goldman Sachs Inc.】

item.title: 这个逾越节，每个人都有问题
item.description:
来自市场的信息是，是时候做出严肃的回答了。【原文：

The message from markets is that it’s time for some serious answers.

】

item.title: 中国允许新建煤电厂至 2027 年，以填补可再生能源缺口
item.description: 根据中国政府的新指导方针，中国将允许燃煤发电厂的建设至少持续到 2027 年，该指导方针还呼吁发电企业确保能够满足间歇性可再生能源的供应缺口。【原文：China will allow coal-fired power plants to be built through at least 2027, according to new guidelines from the government, which also call on generators to ensure they’re able to meet gaps in supply from intermittent renewables.】

item.title: 索尼将 PS5 在欧洲的售价提高 25%，而美国很可能会提价
item.description: 索尼集团公司将其 PlayStation 5 游戏机在欧洲和英国的售价提高了约 25%，而美国的售价很可能会提高。【原文：Sony Group Corp. raised the price of its PlayStation 5 console by around 25% in Europe and in the UK ahead of a likely US increase.】

item.title: 摩根大通的米歇尔因美联储和储备金数据对债券持更积极态度
item.description: 摩根大通资产管理公司（JPMorgan Asset Management）认为，在外国需求强劲的迹象以及美联储将在必要时支持美国国债的预期下，国债目前可能已经触底。【原文：Treasuries may have hit the bottom for now amid signs of robust foreign demand and expectations for the Federal Reserve to support US government debt when needed, according to JPMorgan Asset Management.】

item.title: 顶级银行称南非向交易型电力市场迈进
item.description: 据一家顶级投资银行称，南非即将启动电力交易市场，为消费者提供电力产品选择和一系列定价方案。【原文：South Africa is on the cusp of starting a traded electricity market that will give consumers a choice of power products along with a range of pricing options, according to a top investment bank.】
